instruction: Show full kernel version and build date
List block devices with their UUIDs
Display detailed CPU information (architecture, cores, threads)
windows_cmd: wmic cpu get caption, deviceid, name, numberofcores, maxclockspeed

instruction: Show memory slot usage and capacity
windows_cmd: wmic memorychip get capacity, speed, devicelocator

instruction: List USB devices in a tree structure
Check laptop battery health and status
Show the date and time of the last system boot

windows_cmd: wmic path win32_pncentity where "deviceid like 'PCI%'" get name, deviceid

instruction: Show OS release information (distro, version, codename)
Display the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN)
List all open ports and associated processes
Get the serial number of the hard drive
List all groups the current user belongs to

windows_cmd: echo Check Event Viewer Security Log

mac: sudo powermetrics --samplers smc | grep -i "CPU die temperature"

windows_cmd: echo Windows handles limits differently per process/system.

instruction: Check current runlevel or boot target
windows_cmd: echo Windows uses Sessions, not Runlevels.

instruction: Check Bluetooth status and controller info
windows_cmd: wmic path Win32_PNPEntity where "Caption like '%Bluetooth%'" get Caption
echo NTFS doesn't use inodes in the same way.

Display user ID (uid) and group ID (gid)
Check the version of the current shell
